{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Top Accounts Manager",
  "description": "Glovo - We&rsquo;re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you&#39;ll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Top Accounts Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

The Journey


	Lead a high-performing team of 8+ Account Managers and Senior AMs, coaching them to deliver measurable impact through strategic partner performance, operational excellence, and revenue growth.
	Shape and execute our long-term partner commercial strategy: growth plans, promotional strategies, advertising strategies, and data-led partner segmentation.
	Own and drive the P&amp;L of Glovo&rsquo;s top partners and champion strategic partner relationships, from negotiation to retention, to ensure we are the platform of choice for Nigeria&rsquo;s biggest and most influential restaurants.
	Monitor and improve key business KPIs: GMV growth, partners ads investment &amp; ROAS, and coverage/expansion, constantly driving team&rsquo;s commercial excellence.
	Set the gold standard for Account Management practices at Glovo Nigeria and beyond.


What you will bring to the ride


	You have a solid experience in fast-paced environments (startup, investment banking, top consulting firms or top tech companies)
	Relevant experience leading cross functional or commercial teams of 5+ people
	A data-driven mentality, taking decisions based on data and using good business judgment when necessary
	A growth obsession, you know how to create value, drive ROI, and scale operations sustainably
	The ability to influence at all levels, from internal stakeholders to C-level partners
	You&#39;re persuasive in the most pleasant possible way and have no trouble selling anything that brings value to customers/partners and the Glovo platform
	You&rsquo;re an owner, you have a natural bias for action, always pushing for things to happen, objective and deadline oriented with a hands-on spirit.
	A reputation as a people-first leader: you inspire, coach, and stretch your team to grow.
	You find smart solutions to complex and multi-disciplinary challenges with a great critical-thinking
	You have an ambition that makes some people think you&#39;re crazy because you are ahead of the edge while inspiring the vast majority
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-29",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Glovo Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193766"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Top Accounts Manager Job at Glovo Nigeria




        
    

        
        Glovo - We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Top Accounts Manager

Job Location:  Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

The Journey
     

            
    




	Lead a high-performing team of 8+ Account Managers and Senior AMs, coaching them to deliver measurable impact through strategic partner performance, operational excellence, and revenue growth.
	Shape and execute our long-term partner commercial strategy: growth plans, promotional strategies, advertising strategies, and data-led partner segmentation.
	Own and drive the P&L of Glovo’s top partners and champion strategic partner relationships, from negotiation to retention, to ensure we are the platform of choice for Nigeria’s biggest and most influential restaurants.
	Monitor and improve key business KPIs: GMV growth, partners ads investment & ROAS, and coverage/expansion, constantly driving team’s commercial excellence.
	Set the gold standard for Account Management practices at Glovo Nigeria and beyond.


What you will bring to the ride


	You have a solid experience in fast-paced environments (startup, investment banking, top consulting firms or top tech companies)
	Relevant experience leading cross functional or commercial teams of 5+ people
	A data-driven mentality, taking decisions based on data and using good business judgment when necessary
	A growth obsession, you know how to create value, drive ROI, and scale operations sustainably
	The ability to influence at all levels, from internal stakeholders to C-level partners
	You're persuasive in the most pleasant possible way and have no trouble selling anything that brings value to customers/partners and the Glovo platform
	You’re an owner, you have a natural bias for action, always pushing for things to happen, objective and deadline oriented with a hands-on spirit.
	A reputation as a people-first leader: you inspire, coach, and stretch your team to grow.
	You find smart solutions to complex and multi-disciplinary challenges with a great critical-thinking
	You have an ambition that makes some people think you're crazy because you are ahead of the edge while inspiring the vast majority
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Supply Operations Analyst",
  "description": "Glovo - We&rsquo;re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you&#39;ll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Supply Operations Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

The Journey


	Supply Growth and Optimization: Own supply growth and performance across assigned cities. Ensure the right number of couriers are active, productive, and earning sustainably to support demand growth.
	Supply Planning and Forecasting: Work with HQ ops and growth teams to forecast supply needs based on demand plans, seasonality and special events. Proactively identify gaps and define actions to close them.
	Courier Performance and Earnings: Analyze courier behavior and performance then design and support initiatives that improve productivity and earnings quality.
	Operational Bottleneck Resolution: Identify operational bottlenecks impacting supply performance then drive root cause analysis and execution of fixes.
	On the Ground Ops Support: Spend time in cities working closely with different&nbsp; teams and riders to validate data insights, test interventions, and adapt solutions to local realities.
	Cross Functional Collaboration: Partner with Growth, Commercial, Product, and Support teams to ensure supply plans are aligned with demand, incentives, and city priorities.
	Metrics Ownership and Reporting: Own key supply metrics for your cities. Build and maintain clear reporting on supply health, risks, and progress against targets. Translate insights into actionable recommendations.
	Continuous Improvement:&nbsp;Test, measure, and scale operational improvements. Document learnings and help standardize best practices across cities.


What you will bring to the ride


	A strong analytical mindset with the ability to turn data into clear operational actions, not just reports
	2 to 4 years of experience in operations, consulting, startups, or business roles in fast paced environments
	A proven track record of execution. You follow through, deliver results, and can point to real outcomes you&rsquo;ve driven
	Strong ownership mindset. You take responsibility for supply performance in your cities and push through blockers until issues are resolved
	Ability to balance speed with attention to detail. You move fast without losing control of the fundamentals
	Clear and concise communication, especially when working with remote and cross functional teams
	Hands on and scrappy approach. You are comfortable getting close to the operation, riders, and local teams
	High level of autonomy and strong prioritization skills
	An empathetic, inclusive, and curious attitude. You understand that supply performance is driven by people as much as systems
	Willingness to spend time on the ground in cities when needed to validate insights and drive impact.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-29",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Glovo Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193765"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Supply Operations Analyst Job at Glovo Nigeria




        
    

        
        Glovo - We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Operations Analyst

Job Location: Lagos

The Journey
     

            
    




	Supply Growth and Optimization: Own supply growth and performance across assigned cities. Ensure the right number of couriers are active, productive, and earning sustainably to support demand growth.
	Supply Planning and Forecasting: Work with HQ ops and growth teams to forecast supply needs based on demand plans, seasonality and special events. Proactively identify gaps and define actions to close them.
	Courier Performance and Earnings: Analyze courier behavior and performance then design and support initiatives that improve productivity and earnings quality.
	Operational Bottleneck Resolution: Identify operational bottlenecks impacting supply performance then drive root cause analysis and execution of fixes.
	On the Ground Ops Support: Spend time in cities working closely with different  teams and riders to validate data insights, test interventions, and adapt solutions to local realities.
	Cross Functional Collaboration: Partner with Growth, Commercial, Product, and Support teams to ensure supply plans are aligned with demand, incentives, and city priorities.
	Metrics Ownership and Reporting: Own key supply metrics for your cities. Build and maintain clear reporting on supply health, risks, and progress against targets. Translate insights into actionable recommendations.
	Continuous Improvement: Test, measure, and scale operational improvements. Document learnings and help standardize best practices across cities.


What you will bring to the ride


	A strong analytical mindset with the ability to turn data into clear operational actions, not just reports
	2 to 4 years of experience in operations, consulting, startups, or business roles in fast paced environments
	A proven track record of execution. You follow through, deliver results, and can point to real outcomes you’ve driven
	Strong ownership mindset. You take responsibility for supply performance in your cities and push through blockers until issues are resolved
	Ability to balance speed with attention to detail. You move fast without losing control of the fundamentals
	Clear and concise communication, especially when working with remote and cross functional teams
	Hands on and scrappy approach. You are comfortable getting close to the operation, riders, and local teams
	High level of autonomy and strong prioritization skills
	An empathetic, inclusive, and curious attitude. You understand that supply performance is driven by people as much as systems
	Willingness to spend time on the ground in cities when needed to validate insights and drive impact.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Secretary to Chairman & Marketing Manager (Female) Job at Kingrock International Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Kingrock International Nigeria Limited, founded in 2012, is a leading player in Nigeria’s mining industry. Headquartered in Abuja, we specialize in the exploration, development, and processing of mineral resources across the country. With a strong commitment to sustainable practices, safety, and technological innovation, we have built a reputation for excellence and reliability in the sector. Our dynamic team and forward-thinking leadership continue to drive growth and expansion in both local and international markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary to Chairman & Marketing Manager (Female)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Key Responsibilities


	Manage executive scheduling, administrative operations, and cross-functional PR initiatives
	Oversee project lifecycles: Planning → Implementation → Monitoring → Reporting
	Serve as primary liaison for internal/external stakeholders with timely communication
	Conduct performance analysis and deliver executive briefings
	Coordinate high-level meetings and business engagements.


Qualifications & Attributes


	Educational background: Senior High School Diploma (minimum of a Bachelor’s degree from top-tier universities preferred) with 1-10 years of  experience
	≤26 years old | Height ≥165cm
	Exceptional personal presence: Professional image, polished demeanor, and strong etiquette awareness
	Foundational qualities: Proactive mindset, cultural sensitivity, and grace under pressure
	Technical proficiency: Advanced computer literacy (MS Office Suite required; CRM tools a plus).


Core Requirements:
Professional Excellence:


	International corporate exposure (preferred)
	Business fluency in English (clear articulation) + Chinese proficiency (advantageous)
	Demonstrated business etiquette and personal brand consciousness.


Personal Attributes:


	Impeccable grooming and socially adept disposition
	Growth mindset with commitment to continuous improvement
	Unquestionable integrity and loyalty to organizational values.


Operational Competencies:


	Self-driven project execution with end-to-end ownership
	Leadership aptitude: Team coordination + conflict resolution
	Advanced writing skills for executive communications
	Strategic networking capabilities across cultures.


Salary
N50,000 - N200,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates shouldsend their CV with professional photo to: kaibonigeria@kaibogroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only female candidates will be considered per business requirements
	If you are interested, please contact Mr. Minat, 09112336051.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Contract Manager",
  "description": "DP World - We exist to make the world&rsquo;s trade flow better, changing what&rsquo;s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally. With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 108,100 employees spanning 74 countries on six continents. We are pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that&rsquo;s fit for the future. We&rsquo;re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology &ndash; and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Contract Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Description
The Contract manager will be: (but not limited to):


	Manage all vessel contract from point of on-hire up until the point of off-hire in line with applicable charter party.
	Be the principal point of contact for the client during the term of any charter.
	Review Scope of Work for any enquiries and tenders to ensure that the Company and the intended vessel(s) meet the requirements for operation with the capacity and capability of the vessel, crew and supporting organisation.
	Ensure that Commercial is advised of all down time days and other problems/deviations that may affect the charter party, invoicing or our goof working relations with the client.
	Ensure, in close coordination with Offshore Director and the commercial team, that all clients are visited on a regular basis and that the company is well represented within the Energy / Marine Community.

Contract Manager Job at DP World




        
    

        
        DP World - We exist to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally. With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 108,100 employees spanning 74 countries on six continents. We are pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future. We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Contract Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
The Contract manager will be: (but not limited to):


	Manage all vessel contract from point of on-hire up until the point of off-hire in line with applicable charter party.
	Be the principal point of contact for the client during the term of any charter.
	Review Scope of Work for any enquiries and tenders to ensure that the Company and the intended vessel(s) meet the requirements for operation with the capacity and capability of the vessel, crew and supporting organisation.
	Ensure that Commercial is advised of all down time days and other problems/deviations that may affect the charter party, invoicing or our goof working relations with the client.
	Ensure, in close coordination with Offshore Director and the commercial team, that all clients are visited on a regular basis and that the company is well represented within the Energy / Marine Community.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Technical Technical Assistant Consultant",
  "description": "Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Technical Technical Assistant Consultant&nbsp;- Nigeria

Job ID:&nbsp;req24832
Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

About the Project


	The WISH Dividend Policy and Systems programme supports an African-led, inclusive accelerated Demographic Transition (DT) and advance sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) through Technical Assistance (TA) activities in 7 countries in Sub Saharan Africa.
	WISH Dividend P&amp;S is a component of the wider WISH 2 Dividend, a significant investment from the British Government in Demographic Transition and SRHR to unlock the potential, agency, and freedom of women and girls to achieve gender equality and is central to delivering the UK&rsquo;s priorities on Empowering Women and Girls set out in the International Development Strategy.
	Through WISH P&amp;S, Palladium will improve national capacity to catalyse an accelerated inclusive demographic transition and an improved enabling policy and health systems environment for SRHR.


Objectives of the Assignment
&nbsp;The Technical Assistance aims to:&nbsp;


	Conduct a root cause analysis of ownership gaps in last-mile FP commodity delivery&nbsp;
	Map institutional roles and accountability frameworks.&nbsp;
	Identify&nbsp;financial and human resource constraints.&nbsp;
	Develop actionable recommendations and a short-term roadmap to strengthen ownership and sustainability.&nbsp;


Scope of Work
The consultant will undertake the following tasks:&nbsp;


	Conduct a rapid diagnostic of current last-mile delivery mechanisms&nbsp;in&nbsp;Jigawa&nbsp;State.&nbsp;
	Map stakeholders and analyse their roles, responsibilities, and accountability structures.&nbsp;
	Identify bottlenecks and institutional gaps contributing to poor ownership.&nbsp;
	Facilitate consultations and workshops with key actors to validate findings.&nbsp;
	Develop recommendations and a short-term roadmap for strengthening ownership.&nbsp;


Minimum Requirements


	Advanced&nbsp;degree (at least Masters) in Social Sciences,&nbsp;Development Studies, Medicine, Public Health, Supply Chain Management/Logistics&nbsp;or any other related fields.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Experience:&nbsp;5&ndash;7+ years of experience in health logistics, pharmaceutical supply management, or reproductive health program management, with a specific focus on last-mile operations.
	Demonstrable experience in conducting Root Cause Analysis or other&nbsp;systemic&nbsp;evaluations within the public health sector&nbsp;
	Strong background in institutional strengthening, governance, and accountability frameworks.
	Experience working with government agencies, private sector, and community stakeholders.
	Excellent facilitation, communication, and report-writing skills.&nbsp;
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-29",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": ""
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",

      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,

Technical Technical Assistant Consultant Job at Palladium




        
    

        
        Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Technical Assistant Consultant - Nigeria

Job ID: req24832
Job Location: Nigeria

About the Project
     

            
    




	The WISH Dividend Policy and Systems programme supports an African-led, inclusive accelerated Demographic Transition (DT) and advance sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) through Technical Assistance (TA) activities in 7 countries in Sub Saharan Africa.
	WISH Dividend P&S is a component of the wider WISH 2 Dividend, a significant investment from the British Government in Demographic Transition and SRHR to unlock the potential, agency, and freedom of women and girls to achieve gender equality and is central to delivering the UK’s priorities on Empowering Women and Girls set out in the International Development Strategy.
	Through WISH P&S, Palladium will improve national capacity to catalyse an accelerated inclusive demographic transition and an improved enabling policy and health systems environment for SRHR.


Objectives of the Assignment
 The Technical Assistance aims to: 


	Conduct a root cause analysis of ownership gaps in last-mile FP commodity delivery 
	Map institutional roles and accountability frameworks. 
	Identify financial and human resource constraints. 
	Develop actionable recommendations and a short-term roadmap to strengthen ownership and sustainability. 


Scope of Work
The consultant will undertake the following tasks: 


	Conduct a rapid diagnostic of current last-mile delivery mechanisms in Jigawa State. 
	Map stakeholders and analyse their roles, responsibilities, and accountability structures. 
	Identify bottlenecks and institutional gaps contributing to poor ownership. 
	Facilitate consultations and workshops with key actors to validate findings. 
	Develop recommendations and a short-term roadmap for strengthening ownership. 


Minimum Requirements


	Advanced degree (at least Masters) in Social Sciences, Development Studies, Medicine, Public Health, Supply Chain Management/Logistics or any other related fields.  
	Experience: 5–7+ years of experience in health logistics, pharmaceutical supply management, or reproductive health program management, with a specific focus on last-mile operations.
	Demonstrable experience in conducting Root Cause Analysis or other systemic evaluations within the public health sector 
	Strong background in institutional strengthening, governance, and accountability frameworks.
	Experience working with government agencies, private sector, and community stakeholders.
	Excellent facilitation, communication, and report-writing skills.
